doc.previous: In the spirit of Augustine's Confessions is the 12th-century Historia Calamitatum of Peter Abelard, outstanding as an autobiographical document of its period.
after: The first autobiographical work in Islamic society was written in the late 11th century, by Abdallah ibn Buluggin, last Zirid king of Granada.
In the 15th century, Leonor LÃ³pez de CÃ³rdoba, a Spanish noblewoman, wrote her Memorias, which may be the first autobiography in Castillian.
